did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.abstract: Poem by John O'Hara laid, and referred to, in a copy of Call of the Wildinscribed by Jack London to O'Hara.

See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Myers O'Hara, Atavism, 1902, Accession #11194, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: 1902 November Poem by John Myers O'Hara, "Atavism," referred to in an inscription by Jack London to O'Hara in a copy of The Call of the Wild, "Dear John Myers O'Hara: Whose fugitive four lines gave me my motif for The Call of the Wild and whose same four lines have brought me to him as a friend. Affectionately yours, Jack London, Wake Robin Lodge, Aug. 24, 1909." (See Rare Books, Barrett PS 3523.O46C3 1908)
